newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent untraded, but holding London levels.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent untraded, but holding London levels.

text.p: September Brent crude futures were untraded at midday on Monday, holding levels around the London close.
Both London and New York fell sharply on Friday as worries about disruption to U.S. Gulf output faded.
Hurrican Danny passed over the Gulf and oil workers were returning to rigs on Friday.
September Brent in London ended down 57 cents at $18.12 per barrel, while NYMEX August crude fell 72 cents to $19.27.
At midday in Asia, September Brent on SIMEX was quoted at $18.05/$18.18 per barrel on SIMEX.
August NYMEX crude, trading on the out-of-hours ACCESS system, was last done at $19.23, for a loss of four cents from New York's close.
Brent closed just one cent above the intraday low and NYMEX ended 12 cents above the low, which might weigh on sentiment Monday, brokers said.
Otherwise, Brent was in the middle of its recent trading range of $17.80 to $18.80.
